body:
This is to do with the revamp of the timeout code in 0cb9bb3b54397ff2dd7a563194d1ec98ca9cedaa

The not turning timeouts off if 0 is a bug.

What I think is happening in your case is the read timeout is firing even though writes are going through just fine.

I'll confirm that and give the logic a little tweak, then post a beta for you to try.
That is a beta for you to have a go with - I think it is fixed!

@ncw I am still seeing timeouts with that build over a high speed connection in the same AWS region:

```
rclone move test.img adfb:Test -v
2016/10/06 02:18:05 rclone: Version "v1.33-41-g90aee8c-fix-timeoutβ" starting with parameters ["rclone" "move" "test.img" "adfb:Test" "-v"]
2016/10/06 02:18:05 amazon drive root 'Test': Modify window not supported
2016/10/06 02:18:06 amazon drive root 'Test': Waiting for checks to finish
2016/10/06 02:18:06 amazon drive root 'Test': Waiting for transfers to finish
2016/10/06 02:19:05
Transferred:   4.370 GBytes (74.220 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:      1m0.2s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.img: 100% done. avg: 76620.7, cur: 57323.3 kByte/s. ETA: 0s

2016/10/06 02:19:57 pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 632.969758ms (1 consecutive low level retries)
2016/10/06 02:19:57 pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: net/http: timeout awaiting response headers)
2016/10/06 02:19:57 test.img: Received error: Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: net/http: timeout awaiting response headers - low level retry 1/10
2016/10/06 02:19:57 pacer: Resetting sleep to minimum 20ms on success
2016/10/06 02:20:05
Transferred:   5.006 GBytes (42.616 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:      2m0.2s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.img: 14% done. avg: 86719.7, cur: 52188.8 kByte/s. ETA: 1m15s

2016/10/06 02:21:05
Transferred:   8.740 GBytes (49.639 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:      3m0.2s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.img: 100% done. avg: 67689.9, cur: 42451.7 kByte/s. ETA: 0s

2016/10/06 02:21:57 pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 263.669287ms (1 consecutive low level retries)
2016/10/06 02:21:57 pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: net/http: timeout awaiting response headers)
2016/10/06 02:21:57 test.img: Received error: Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: net/http: timeout awaiting response headers - low level retry 2/10
2016/10/06 02:21:57 pacer: Resetting sleep to minimum 20ms on success
2016/10/06 02:22:05
Transferred:   9.411 GBytes (40.107 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:      4m0.2s
Transferring:
 *                                      test.img: 15% done. avg: 87326.3, cur: 76585.5 kByte/s. ETA: 50s

^C
```

After aborting I waited some time and then the file appeared in the cloud drive web ui.

Tested using a t2.large ec2 instance in us-east-1a on Ubuntu 16.04 amd64. Source was a on EFS.

@ncw It works on the first upload try with `--contimeout 5m`. Should I open another issue?

I'm not sure what causes the delay between upload and the file turning up in the UI. It could be that they are using S3 COPY in the background to convert a multipart upload into a single part upload with a valid MD5SUM in the ETag.

Thanks for testing. 

I'll fix on this issue don't worry about opening a new one. 

The speculation is that it is something to do with calculating the hash, yes.
I've fixed this now - find the beta in http://beta.rclone.org/v1.33-56-gd42b386/ (in about 15 minutes)
@ncm Thanks, it's now working fine without any switches.

Hi Felix,

I suspect you must have been intending to write to someone else...

Nathan Myers

On 10/08/2016 02:23 PM, Felix Bünemann wrote:

> @ncm https://github.com/ncm Thanks, it's now working fine without any
> switches.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/766#issuecomment-252440122, or
> mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AANIB3mct6mr1Sdu6dh-gqTu_ZNVLfq0ks5qx9-ggaJpZM4KOJU3.
